temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:14:02
item.description:
in reference to:

这也解释了仿生阅读为什么妨碍了习惯扫读的读者。对于这些人来说，可能整体高亮关键词、或者高亮句首、段首会更有用。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:15:27
item.description:
in reference to:

从这个角度来讲，仿生阅读也未必适用于所有文章。沈阳师范大学曾做过一项文本标注对中文阅读眼动的研究。研究显示，虽然添加高亮会指引和帮助参与者们更好地记忆重点内容、忽略干扰内容，但如果含有错误标识或标识过多，那与无标识的阅读效率几乎是一样的。同时，如果阅读的文本是比较简单的内容，那标示也未必可以提高正确率。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:16:51
item.description:
in reference to:

加粗分词后的第一个字确实有助于帮助断句、加快阅读。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:13:01
item.description:
in reference to:

人类医学史上第一个真正意义上的对照临床试验。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:17:45
item.description:
in reference to:

所以后来索性把医生的眼睛也蒙起来——不告诉医疗人员哪组是安慰剂组哪组是实验组，所有的结果由第三方机构去统计和评判，这就是双盲对照实验。这种测试最大限度地排除了病人的安慰剂效应和医生的主观偏好，成为了判断药物客观疗效最有力的证据，现代医学的“金标准”。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:22:29
item.description:
in reference to:

some of the reasons have nothing to do with choosing the “best learning tool,” but with regards to how my workflow and my life have changed.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:23:28
item.description:
in reference to:

The two core features I need are spaced repetition and bi-directional linking.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:25:54
item.description:
in reference to:

I focused almost entirely on optimizing when I should review the material. My partner made to realize that any spaced repetition algorithm is only half of the story. The other half is how you engage with the material.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:44:26
item.description:
in reference to:

From now on, my focus on “how to learn” would be shifted from “when should I review this” to “what should I do when I indeed review this?” It’ll be about thinking frameworks and mental models; it’s about “what and how to think” instead of “when to think.”

item.description:
in reference to:

此时的游牧教室，几乎变成了一层套一层的叠加小宇宙。最内层是学生的头脑。包裹着它的，是我们的对话（以及白板互动）。在这一层对话之外，是我的头脑（其中有无数可能突然才想起来的事例、材料，以及数字卡片资料）。而在我的物质身体之外是书库中无数的书架。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Automating Read It Later Articles to DEVONthink - GeekDad in the user temberature at 2022-08-27T04:50:54
item.description:
in reference to:

So when you see something you want to dive into later when you have a bit more time… you have to put it somewhere. That is where a “read-it-later” service like Pocket or Instapaper comes in. Basic features with these services are free, but if you want more advanced features like “search” you have to pay. In the case of Pocket, it will cost you $4.99 a month or $44.99 a year to keep a permanent library of saved articles and be able to search the content of those articles.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Automating Read It Later Articles to DEVONthink - GeekDad in the user temberature at 2022-08-27T04:51:38
item.description:
in reference to:

Then many months later I will need to do something related to “that article I read a while back” and I have no way to find it. That is where DEVONthink comes in.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 年度征文 | 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ - 少数派 in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T03:31:33

其实我就能找到之前所有提到该内容的地方，而这个地方的「快」是非常重要的。我常常把 DEVONthink 比作是一栋楼当中的地下室或者是楼阁，当我们需要找什么内容的时候，我们能够非常快速地去找。虽然说平常不会去楼阁里面翻东西，但只要它搜索起来很快，你就能够快速地去找到想要的内容。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/devonthink - Is DEVONthink worth it? in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T04:02:11
item.description:
in reference to:

I suppose it depends what you want to use it for. I use it for research mainly. It is excellent for document storage and analysts and it has been a game changer for me. Coupled with its ability with RSS feeds and Devon agent, I have to say it is superb. I suspect I’m only scratching the surface of its capability. It is a pretty steep learning curve but it’s capabilities are massive.Have a look at the videos on www.screencastsonline.com there is a free membership for 7 days which should give you some idea of what it is capable of. They were a great intro for me.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How long does it take to master a language like a native speaker? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:10:21
item.description:
in reference to:

I find that memorizing a number of ‘filler’ words or sentences can greatly increase your ability to come off as native, as well as knowing some expressions and sayings. Instead of expressing agreement with a simple ‘yes’ you could try responding with “you know what? I Agree!” or “I think I see what you mean”. It’s agreement either way but it sounds a lot more ‘native’.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:16:14
item.description:
in reference to:

所以说，再举个用好重器 20% 功能的例子，对于 DEVONthink 来说，我觉得它最重要的就是 Search 搜索功能。比如说我通过 Alfred 的 DEVONthink 插件快速输入「重器轻用」，然后我就可以搜到在 DEVONthink 里面所有关于「重器轻用」的信息。而这个搜索速度是极快的，并且在右侧边栏，你可以看到搜索结果有一个展现的区域，让你快速知道哪些地方有相关文字的一个出处。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Taekman Academic Writing Workflow 2020 — Workflows in Personal and Professional Productivity in the user temberature at 2022-09-03T14:00:55
item.description:
in reference to:

Devonthink indexes (not imports) multiple folders including: the PDF folder generated by Bookends in iCloud, The Archive Folder in Dropbox, and my Annotations Folder in Dropbox.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Folder Structure to Maximize Writing with Devonthink Pro — Workflows in Personal and Professional Productivity in the user temberature at 2022-09-03T14:29:11
item.description:
in reference to:

Although at one point I had all my information on manuscripts in a single DTP database, over the last year I have maintained separate databases; one for PDFs, another for my annotations.I accomplish this by having separate folders in Dropbox. After extracting my annotations from Highlights.app, I place the exported files in their own folder. Once a month, I export all the PDFs in my Paper’s Library to their own Dropbox folder. I use a Hazel script to throw away any duplicate PDFs in the Dropbox folder. I index (not import) the annotations folder into one DTP database, and index my PDFs into another.

item.description:
in reference to:

To use this feature, simply drag your existing PDFs into your Zotero library or use the “Store Copy of File” or “Link to File” options from the add new item menu (green plus sign). By default, Zotero will automatically retrieve metadata for each PDF, create an appropriate parent item, and rename the associated file based on the metadata. (You can disable these automatic functions in the General pane of Zotero preferences.)

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (91 封私信 / 80 条消息) 石墨烯电暖产品是真的还是假的？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-11-11T17:12:14
item.description:
in reference to:

石墨烯地暖目前最大的问题在「涂层」，如果不去做好「封装」，长时间会氧化、粉化及脱落，不可能做到耐用 20 万小时。加上采用丝印工艺，两端涂布不均匀，容易产生「电阻差」，功率不到几年就衰退了，结果就是更耗电而你不自知！

item.description:
in reference to:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (91 封私信 / 80 条消息) 为什么饭店的大铁锅从来都不粘锅？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-11-14T09:28:19
item.description:
in reference to:

正常饭店炒菜流程，首先预热锅，锅的温度加热到200-300度，放油，均匀涂到锅底后立即下食材，这时候油作为导热液体，迅速加热食材表面，食材表面水分剧烈沸腾，莱顿弗罗斯特效应主导，形成一层蒸汽膜，达成不粘。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Git - Git Configuration in the user temberature at 2022-11-15T04:43:42
item.description:
in reference to:

Git can handle this by auto-converting CRLF line endings into LF when you add a file to the index, and vice versa when it checks out code onto your filesystem. You can turn on this functionality with the core.autocrlf setting. If you’re on a Windows machine, set it to true — this converts LF endings into CRLF when you check out code: $ git config --global core.autocrlf true

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Google Colaboratory in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T12:55:17
item.description:
in reference to:

Sections should be large enough to contain enough information to answer a question; but small enough to fit one or several into the GPT-3 prompt. We find that approximately a paragraph of text is usually a good length, but you should experiment for your particular use case.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated OpenAI API in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T16:00:10
item.description:
in reference to:

There are two ways to limit the likelihood of the API making up an answer.Provide a ground truth for the API. If you provide the API with a body of text to answer questions about (like a Wikipedia entry) it will be less likely to confabulate a response.Use a low probability and show the API how to say "I don't know". If the API understands that in cases where it's less certain about a response that saying "I don't know" or some variation is appropriate, it will be less inclined to make up answers.
